Description.val:
The Submarine Acoustic Warfare System (SAWS) program provides submarines with expendable defensive countermeasures and the systems necessary to externally launch against torpedo and acoustic sensor threats. This program provides ongoing production of countermeasure devices needed to sustain fleet inventories, improvements to enhance the readiness and effectiveness of countermeasure devices and associated External Countermeasure Launcher (ECL) systems on all U.S. submarines. Acoustic Device Countermeasures (ADC) are expendable devices produced in two primary versions.  The Internal Countermeasure Launcher (ICL) launches the 3" ADC's and ECL Systems launch the and 6" devices.

WM018 - The Acoustic Augmentation Support Program (AASP) provides acoustic augmentation systems in appropriate configurations for all submarine classes (except SEAWOLF) installed as temporary equipment Temporary Alteration (TEMPALT). A combination of new procurement systems (10) and refurbished systems (8) are required to complete Virginia Blocks I-III (18) installations. A revision to extend the SHIPALT to Virginia Blocks IV completed in FY19 and installs will start in FY26. Development of a revision to extend SHIPALT to Virginia Block V will occur in FY21 and installations will start in FY24. Reliability and refurbishment upgrades provide current in-service AASP systems with new components and software updates to maintain reliability. AASP new procurements are required a year prior installation and refurbished systems the same year as installation.

WM019 - The Countermeasure Set, Acoustic (CSA) program procures and supports the inboard electronic system necessary for preparing and launching 6" Acoustic Devices, Countermeasure (ADCs) from all 688i and newer U.S. submarines. This inboard system consists of the Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), Launch Control Panels (LCPs), and associated cabling, in a class-by-class configuration. The CSA program provides obsolescence support for legacy systems and engineering changes to accommodate modified and planned new devices, such as the ADC MK5. Five efforts are supported: (1) The "CSA SWFTS Integration" effort is integrating the CSA system with the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS) System of Systems (SoS). Implementation of a phased approach allowed incremental implementation of initial capabilities. Required funding addresses recurring upgrades within the SWFTS Technology Insertion (TI)/Advanced Processor Build (APB) cycles. (2) The "CSA MK4 Technology Insertion" effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD2 with a SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA MK4 system on VIRGINIA Class Block I and II submarines (10 hulls) are ongoing. (3) The "CSA SEAWOLF SWFTS Integration" effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD5 system on SEAWOLF Class submarines (3 hulls) with a  SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA system. The non-recurring engineering effort will begin in FY21 with fielding beginning in FY23 and the SWFTS TI-22 baseline. (4) The "CSA SWFTS Virtualization" effort supports the development and integration of the CSA system with the AN/BYG-1 Combat Control System on VIRGINIA and COLUMBIA new construction hulls. (5) The fifth effort is the ongoing support for engineering issues across all CSA systems as they arise.

[P40A / WM014 6 INCH]: WM014 6 INCH - The 6" Countermeasures program procures, reworks, and refreshes ADC MK3 (torpedo countermeasure) devices, ADC MK4 (SONAR countermeasure) devices, and associated Launch Tubes in order to maintain submarine fleet countermeasure device inventory levels in accordance with the Naval Munition Requirements Process (NMRP). The 6" Countermeasure program tracks and implements device improvements through configuration control and an Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) process.

[P40A / WM015 3 INCH]: WM015 3 INCH - The 3" Countermeasures program procures ADC MK2 MOD 7 countermeasure devices in order to maintain submarine fleet countermeasure device inventory levels in accordance with the NMRP. The 3" Countermeasures program tracks and implements device improvements through configuration control and the ECP process.

[P40A / WM022 GAS GENERATOR MK77]: WM022 Gas Generator MK 77 - The MK77 Gas Generator (GG) program provides the energetic devise and used as the impulse mechanism for launching 6-inc Acoustic Device Countermeasures (ADC MK3 and ADC MK4) on Virginia, Ohio, Los Angeles Improved and Seawolf U.S. submarine classes. MK77 GG Mod 0 rework is the complete disassembly of a GG that has been deployed and then reassembled into C/C A status with replacement of the inert hardware. MK77 GG Mod 1 is the new procurement unit design to replace the obsolete propellant formulation of the MOD 0 while retaining the same fit and function.

[P40A / WM830 PRODUCTION ENGINEERING]: WM830 - Production Engineering - The Production Engineering line provides production engineering services for SAWS Technical Design Agent (TDA) and In-Service Engineering Agent (ISEA) across all SAWS systems, including AASP. Also provides specification preparation and validation, government prepared production acceptance procedures, production planning, integrated logistics support, planning coordination of government furnished information and government furnished equipment, and contract administration including contract deliverable monitoring and prime contractor monitoring of cost/ schedule performance.

[P40A / PRODUCTION ENGINEERING]: Production Engineering adjustment commensurate with anticipated work to support the ordnance assessment required to extend the service life.

[P40A / WM900 CONSULTING SERVICES]: WM900 Consulting Services - The Consulting Services line procures contractor support services for all SAWS programs including program, financial, acquisition, contract administration and engineering management support.

Justification.val:
FY 2021 SAWS increase procures additional ADC MK4 to meet Fleet requirements.

FY 2021 AASP increase is to extend SHIPALT to Virginia Class BLK V.
 
FY 2021 CSA increase is due to increased funding required to support virtualization/SWFTS and support meeting the SWFTS TI cycle.

Name.@footnote: $2.2M congressional cut (Excessive NRE Growth) and a $.3M cut in FY19 caused a reduction of MK 3 units (from 128 to 81 in FY20) and MK 4 units (from 30 to 28 in FY20) to continue to pay for the NRE and to buy 50 ADC MK 4 SLEP units to relieve MK 4 inventory shortage issues resulting from the schedule delay caused by the budget cut.

ADC MK4 (Sonar) $2.146M added in FY21 to fund procurement of 32 additional ADC MK4 devices to address ADC MK4 inventory shortage issue. ADC MK4 4 (Sonar) $.500M added in FY20 to build 50 ADC MK4 Shelf Life Extension Program (SLEP( units extended from 12 to 16 years to meet inventory requirements and address NMRP shortages.

$2.2M congressional cut (Excessive NRE Growth) and a $.3M cut in FY19 caused a reduction of MK 3 units (from 128 to 81 in FY20) and MK 4 units (from 30 to 28 in FY20) to continue to pay for the NRE and to buy 50 ADC MK 4 SLEP units to relieve MK 4 inventory shortage issues resulting from the schedule delay caused by the budget cut.
MK77 MOD 1 units will start to be available for rework in FY22. Rework of a combinations of MK77 MOD 0 and MK77 MOD 1 will occur between FY22 and FY24.

Description.val:
The Acoustic Augmentation Support Program (AASP) provides acoustic augmenting systems in appropriate configurations for all submarine classes (except SEAWOLF) installed as temporary equipment (a TEMPALT). A permanent SHIPALT for VIRGINIA Class Block IV was completed in FY19 and installations will start in FY26, gradually phasing out the TEMPALTs on VIRGINIA Class. Development of a revision to extend SHIPALT to Virginia Block V will occur in FY21 and installations will start in FY24. Reliability and refurbishment upgrades provide current in-service AASP systems with new components and software updates to maintain reliability. AASP new procurements are required a year prior installation and refurbished systems the same year as installation.

[WM018 AASP Support] Includes production support for BLK I-IV SHIPALTS and the AASP reliability and refurbishment upgrade.

[WM018 AASP (Acoustic Augmentation Support Program)] AASP includes costs of procuring new systems including HLF-1, for SHIPALD 4678KP.

[WM018 AASP Reliability and Refurbishment Upgrade] Reliability and refurbishment upgrade to sustain in-service AASP systems.

[WM018 AASP (Acoustic Augmentation Support Program)] Non-recurring costs to produce AASP SHIPALT alteration packages.

Name.@footnote: Installations were updated to reflect the current install schedule on Naval Tool for Interoperability Risk Assessment (NTIRA).

CSA Engineering Changes (1.1.6) reflects organic CSA engineering support efforts less the SEAWOLF effort. Description.val:
WM019 - The Countermeasure Set, Acoustic (CSA) program procures and supports the inboard electronic system necessary for preparing and launching 6" Acoustic Devices, Countermeasure (ADCs) from all 688i and newer U.S. submarines. This inboard system consists of the Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), Launch Control Panels (LCPs), and associated cabling, in a class-by-class configuration. The CSA program provides obsolescence support for legacy systems and engineering changes to accommodate modified and planned new devices, such as the ADC MK5. Five efforts are supported: (1) The "CSA SWFTS Integration" effort is integrating the CSA system with the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS) System of Systems (SoS) to facilitate the introduction of the ADC MK5 and the Submarine Torpedo Defense (SubTDS) Tactical Decision Aid (TacDA). Implementation of a phased approach was allowed an incremental implementation of initial capabilities. Required funding addresses recurring upgrades within the SWFTS Technology Insertion (TI)/Advanced Processor Build (APB) cycles. (2) The "CSA MK4 Technology Insertion" effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD2 with a SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA MK4 system on VIRGINIA Class Block I and II submarines (10 hulls) are ongoing. (3) The "CSA SEAWOLF SWFTS Integration" effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD5 system on SEAWOLF Class submarines (3 hulls) with a  SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA system. The non-recurring engineering effort will begin in FY21 with fielding beginning in FY23 and the SWFTS TI-22 baseline. (4) The "CSA SWFTS Virtualization" effort supports the development and integration of the CSA system with the AN/BYG-1 Combat Control System on VIRGINIA and COLUMBIA new construction hulls. (5) The fifth effort is the ongoing support of engineering issues across all CSA systems as they arise.

NOTE: Beginning in FY20, the WM019 budget was restructured to align the CSA development and procurement efforts with the SWFTS TI/APB model. The changes reallocated funding entirely within the WM019 subhead to support current and future SWFTS development efforts. This restructuring will provides clarity to the recurring development and procurement costs associated with CSA systems and upgrades within the SWFTS TI/APB model.

[WM019 CSA MK3 Engineering Changes (LAN, SWFTS, TDA)] WM019 CSA Engineering Changes - Organic Technology insertion effort that supports and designs engineering changes for VA Blk III and following ships, including the Countermeasures Set Acoustic (CSA) system, Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), and Launch Control Panels (LCPs). This effort supports changes to correct obsolescence issues, supports SWFTS modernization goals and engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 ECPs CSA MK2 MOD 2 Conversion to MK 4] WM019 - ECPs CSA MK2 MOD2 Conversion to CSA MK4 - Organic Technology insertion effort that converts CSA MK2 MOD2 to CSA MK4 to accommodate introduction of ADC MK5 to Virginia Class Block 1 and 2 Ships (10 hulls) is ongoing.

[WM019 CSA MK2 MOD 0 OBSOLESCENCE] WM019 - CSA MK2 MOD0 Obsolescence - NonOrganic Technology refresh effort that designs, builds, tests and certifies replacement components for obsolete CSA MK2 MOD4 on 688i ships and CSA MK2 MOD0 and 3 on SSBNs.

[WM019 CSAMK2 MOD2 CONVERSION to CSA MK4] WM019 - CSA MK2 MOD2 Conversion to CSA MK4 - NonOrganic Technology Insertion effort that procures engineering change kits and systems including Countermeasures Set Acoustic (CSA) system, Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), Launch Control Panels (LCPs), and CSA support system assets to correct obsolescence, including engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 CSAMK3 Kits and Systems] WM019 - CSA MK3 Kits and Systems - NonOrganic Procures engineering change kits and systems in support of SAWS including Countermeasures Set Acoustic (CSA) system, Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), Launch Control Panels (LCPs), CSA support system assets to correct obsolescence issues, including engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 CSA Engineering Changes  - Organic] WM019 CSA Engineering Changes - Organic Technology insertion effort that supports and designs engineering changes for the Countermeasure Set, Acoustic (CSA) systems fielded on all 688i and newer U.S. submarines. This supports changes to correct obsolescence issues, and engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-20) Upgrade Kits NonOrganic] WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-20) - NonOrganic Procures CSA Technology Insertion to upgrade fielded SWFTS-integrated CSA systems from TI-14 and TI-16 to TI-20 on VIRGINIA Class submarines.

[WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-22) Upgrade Kits NonOrganic] WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-22)  - NonOrganic Procures CSA Technology Insertion to upgrade legacy CSA MK2 MOD 5 systems to TI-22 on SEAWOLF Class submarines.

[WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-24) Upgrade Kits NonOrganic] WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-24) - NonOrganic Procures CSA Technology Insertion to upgrade fielded SWFTS-integrated CSA systems from TI-16 and TI-20 to TI-24 on VIRGINIA Class submarines.

[WM019 CSA SWFTS VIRTUALIZATION - Organic] WM019 - CSA SWFTS VIRTUALIZATION Organic Nonrecurring costs for the upgrade, verification, validation and migration of CSA functionality into the AN/BYG-1 Combat Control System and the Payload Control System (PCS) on SWFTS. CSA Virtualization effort supports advanced integration of the CSA system with the AN/BYG-1 Combat Control System on VIRGINIA and COLUMBIA new construction hulls.

[WM019 CSA SEA WOLF SWFTS Integration - Organic] WM019 - CSA SEAWOLF SWFTS Integration Organic Nonrecurring costs for the upgrade, validation, verification, and SHIPALT for the SWFTS-integrated CSA on SEAWOLF in TI-22. CSA upgrade effort for SEAWOLF will deliver a SubTDS-capable CSA system to be fielded in TI-22 SWFTS baseline.

[WM019 CSA MK2 MOD 2 Conversion to CSA MK4] WM019 - CSA MK2 MOD2 Conversion to CSA MK4 - Organic Nonrecurring costs for the Technology Insertion CSA MK4.

[WM019 CSA ISEA] WM019 - CSA ISEA Supports engineering issues across all systems and platforms as they arise, using ISEA support.

Compact Rapid Attack Weapon (CRAW) is a very lightweight torpedo that can double as a submarine countermeasure. In FY22 CRAW Submarine Integration begins procuring kits to integrate the CRAW into the external countermeasure launcher (ECL) assembly.
